Requirement: Support smart card technology for access control
Reasoning: Foundational enabler for all smart-card and access-related functionality; high value with moderate cost.

Requirement: Map user identity to UPI (UCL Person Identifier), including group memberships and roles
Reasoning: Core identity backbone required for access rights and integrations despite higher cost and risk.

Requirement: Implement a role-based method to grant access rights
Reasoning: Critical dependency for automatic provisioning and centralized access control governance.

Requirement: Import data from staff and student systems
Reasoning: Required to populate card identity and access rights; medium cost and high unblocker.

Requirement: Export data to the library
Reasoning: Supports key library interactions and reduces operational gaps; dependency for integrated card use.

Requirement: Export data to the student system
Reasoning: Enables consistent student record updates; delivers operational alignment early.

Requirement: Export data to the staff system
Reasoning: Complements identity and permissions sync; moderate value and low comparative risk.

Requirement: Control access to library areas
Reasoning: High-value access functionality and dependency for consolidated card library usage.

Requirement: Control access to departments
Reasoning: High-usage area access; supports core project outcomes and security expectations.

Requirement: Use the same access control mechanism for library entrance
Reasoning: Directly contributes to main project goal of consolidation; moderate effort.

Requirement: Integrate ID card and session card functions into one card
Reasoning: Highest value consolidation feature; placed after base access and identity enablers.

Requirement: Integrate Library card function into one card
Reasoning: Major target outcome; sequencing ensures foundation is in place to mitigate integration risk.

Requirement: Integrate Bloomsbury fitness card function into one card
Reasoning: High-value expansion once core integrated card features are operating.

Requirement: Integrate with the Bloomsbury system (Gladstone MRM)
Reasoning: Unblocks specific fitness center and facility usage; medium-high value.

Requirement: Integrate with library systems
Reasoning: High risk and high value; required to realize benefits of card consolidation in libraries.

Requirement: Handle compatibility with library barcodes
Reasoning: Supports a smooth transition to the new system; lower risk so scheduled after major integrations.

Requirement: Automatically provision access rights
Reasoning: Builds on identity foundation and improves operational efficiency; medium value and risk.

Requirement: Automatically suspend access rights
Reasoning: Important for security with high risk; placed after auto-provisioning to avoid stacking risks early.

Requirement: Automatically provision library borrowing rights
Reasoning: Follows library integration; improves automation and user experience.

Requirement: Automatically suspend library borrowing rights
Reasoning: Risky operational automation but necessary for full lifecycle management.

Requirement: Control access to computer clusters
Reasoning: Security-critical spaces but scheduled after broader access coverage to avoid risk clustering.

Requirement: Allow the card to be used for computer logon
Reasoning: Improves user experience and reduces credential fragmentation; high value but depends on core integrations.

Requirement: Support payment mechanism functionality
Reasoning: Enhances adoption and utility; scheduled mid-roadmap due to non-critical nature.

Requirement: Control access to Bloomsbury facilities
Reasoning: Adds additional coverage to extended facilities; follows platform stabilization.

Requirement: Control access to high hazard areas
Reasoning: High impact if failed; placed later while operational maturity increases.

Requirement: Control access to Kathleen Lonsdale
Reasoning: Location-specific extension; value moderate and low dependency impact.

Requirement: Control access to private offices
Reasoning: Expands fine-grained access; moderate priority and complexity.

Requirement: Control access to rooms
Reasoning: Similar to offices but broader; positioned after core environments are supported.

Requirement: Allow viewing and modification of access rights and time of access online without the physical card present
Reasoning: Very high risk, high security sensitivity; implemented once access lifecycle is validated.

Requirement: Allow activation and inactivation of the card
Reasoning: Operational support function that enhances management but with lower value.

Requirement: Allow viewing of data from any computer
Reasoning: Administrative productivity improvement; moderate risk-value balance.

Requirement: Allow updating/deleting of data remotely
Reasoning: Supports decentralized administration once core data flows are stable.

Requirement: Track movement logs in buildings other than the library
Reasoning: Security enhancement but less crucial to core MVP scope.

Requirement: The system must track movement logs in the library
Reasoning: Low cost tracking with moderate value; scheduled after primary access stabilization.

Requirement: Generate reports
Reasoning: Operational insights and compliance support; follows data maturity.

Requirement: Integrate Club and societies card function into one card
Reasoning: Moderate value enhancement; added after main functional areas.

Requirement: Integrate National Health Service (NHS) card function into one card
Reasoning: High complexity external integration; late roadmap reduces impact on core delivery.

Requirement: Enable the card to be used to mark attendance
Reasoning: Adds convenience in niche scenarios; low complexity so scheduled later.

Requirement: Allow data entry
Reasoning: Administrative form-based capability with moderate business impact.

Requirement: Enable photo visual checks
Reasoning: Security support feature; low cost and risk justify late but easy addition.

Requirement: Enable visual checking of the cardholder's role
Reasoning: Enhances on-sight validation; moderate-low priority.

Requirement: Display photo on the card
Reasoning: Supports human validation and trust; dependent on identity and print features.

Requirement: Display UPI (UCL Person Identifier) on the card
Reasoning: High value but waits until card platform and identity mapping stable.

Requirement: Display the card type and user status on the card
Reasoning: Small UI enhancement; benefit gained once most features are active.

Requirement: Support direct printing on both sides of the card
Reasoning: Minor usability feature; scheduled after main functional rollout.

Requirement: Display the PRN (student number) on the card
Reasoning: Very low cost and low value; scheduled late.

Requirement: Display name on the card
Reasoning: Simple improvement to card usability; timed after consolidation achieved.

Requirement: Support new cards for use at the Bloomsbury Fitness Centre
Reasoning: Earlier integrations supersede physical card support; completing physical rollout last.

Requirement: Enable security/reception staff to validate the cardholder's identity
Reasoning: Useful but reliant on prior access control and visual identity features; last for stabilization cleanup.
